snippet: As Ms. Dolezal has refused to back down on her embrace of black identity, some people have applauded her work and others have deplored her methods and actions.
abstract: Rachel A Dolezal, former NAACP chapter president who has come under fire for misrepresenting her racial background, says during first televised interview that she identifies as black; statement represents defiant stance in controversy swirling around Dolezal, who is white.

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JOHN ELIGON
byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Spokane, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo. Bill Morlin contributed reporting from Spokane, Jack Healy from Denver, and Jada F. Smith from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As Ms. Dolezal has refused to back down on her embrace of black identity, some people have applauded her work and others have deplored her methods and actions.

headline.main: Rachel Dolezal, in Center of Storm, Is Defiant: ‘I Identify as Black’
headline.print_headline: At Center of Storm, a Defiant ‘I Identify as Black’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
